description: Dive into "Capturing Goreme: A Photographic Journey" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Capturing Goreme: A Photographic Journey

places.generalDescription: Rose Valley is one of the most beautiful valleys in Cappadocia, offering great hiking opportunities and stunning views. It features several old churches carved into the tufa rock, accessible to everyone. The valley is known for its unique streaks of orange, red, pink, and white rock formations that compete for attention.

sources.snippet: When it comes to natural wonders, Cappadocia in Turkey is known for its unique landscapes and breathtaking views. One of the most enchanting spots in this region is the beautiful Rose Valley. This valley gets its name from the captivating rose-colored tones that can be seen throughout the area, particularly during sunrise and sunset.
sources.shortName: Balloons Of Cappadocia | Top 10 Photo Spots at the Cappadocia Hot Air Balloon Festival

sources.snippet: Some hot-air balloons simply climb very high and then descend, while others fly inside the valleys, approaching very close to fairy chimneys (such as the ‚ÄúValley of Love‚Äù or the ‚ÄúRose Valley‚Äù). I guess it depends on the pilot experience, but when you choose an agency, ask them if you can fly inside the valleys.
sources.shortName: best spots to watch hot air balloons at sunrise

sources.snippet: When you are ready for some quiet time, check out places like Rose Valley or Love Valley. Here you will find yourself surrounded by tall rocks that seem like they are from another planet.
sources.shortName: Top 15 photography spots in Cappadocia: A visual Journey

sources.snippet: Rose Valley: This valley is named after the pink and red hues that the rocks take on during sunset. It's a great spot to capture photos of the colorful landscape during golden hour.
sources.shortName: The best photo spots in Cappadocia

places.name: Rose Valley

reviews.text: The natural scenery is fantastic combined with the history of the rock dwellings we were blown away.  Hiked an AllTrails circuit by hooking up from Kaya Campground maybe 6 miles all in.  Besides the $10 orange juice (which we enjoyed) there was nothing bad about this trip.  The trail got pretty slippery after the Thunderstorm but we loved it.

It was my last day in Goreme and I decided to go on a ATV Tour. This tour generally costs 20 Euros for 2 hours and they cover three valleys - Love Valley, Rose/Red Valley, Sword Valley. I found this tour totally worth it. If you have more time in hand, you can go for a trekking along these valleys as well which can take 6-8 hours. All these valleys are pretty nice and beautiful. On top of that riding ATV through these valleys was a pretty unique and interesting experience. Red/Rose valley has unique formations with red color and hence the name as red valley.

Rose Valley was a great hike in Cappadocia, not to difficult either. You can choose to climb up rocks and hills to achieve better views and make it more exciting but it's not essential.

It's amazing to see all the carvings and dwellings in the rocks, some of them are very high and makes you wonder how they managed to create these all them years ago! Most of of the dwellings are off limits but there are some you can get into and have a look around. Amazing to see some that have 2 stories and carved out stairs between the 2 floors, can only imagine how long it must have taken to make them..

It's a 2/3 hour hike hike so manage your time, we were luck to get it just right and catch the sunset right at the end which was beautiful! We travelled with 2 boys aged 8 and 10 and they enjoyed it very much.  There is also a small shop selling refreshments about half way through but I'd still suggest taking your own water, the shop just pops up when you think you are in the middle of nowhere!! (See Pics)

We enjoyed this hike, no need to do it again but would recommend if your in Cappadocia! We decided to go it on our own, no tour guide and was reasonably straight forward, there are a few valleys and if you plan to visit more then 1 I'd suggest a guide.

places.generalDescription: G√∂reme Sunset Point offers a breathtaking view of the city, making it an ideal spot to witness the sunset. Whether you choose to drive or hike up, the effort is well worth it as you'll be rewarded with a stunning panoramic view of G√∂reme and its surroundings. This location is perfect for observing hot air balloon rides at sunrise as well.

sources.snippet: If you have more time and want to check out more of Cappadocia, some other popular spots include the Sunset Point and the Panoramic View Point. Sunset Point is actually a great free spot to watch the sunrise in Cappadocia. The Panoramic View Point is great for sunset views of the landscape.
sources.shortName: The Most Instagrammable Places in Cappadocia

sources.snippet: Goreme Point is the most loved photography spots in Cappadocia. You will need to get here at least 45 ‚Äì 60 minutes before sunrise to ensure you get the best spot, right on the cliff edge with an uninterrupted view. It will be worth that 3.50 am wake-up call!
sources.shortName: Top 15 photography spots in Cappadocia: A visual Journey

sources.snippet: The best time to arrive is around an hour before sunset when the sun starts to disappear behind the horizon and the rocky landscape all turns a beautiful shade of orange!
sources.shortName: The Best Cappadocia Instagram Photo Locations

places.name: Sunset/Sunrise/Balloons Highest View point in G√∂reme

reviews.text:
This spot offers amazing views during both sunrise and sunset, with hot air balloons filling the sky.

The views from this point are absolutely stunning. You can see the charming town of G√∂reme below and watch hot air balloons floating nearby during sunrise. It's a perfect place for taking photos.

Tips:
Arrive early before sunrise to avoid the crowds and get a good spot to watch the balloons.
Bring a warm jacket because it can be quite cold before sunrise, especially in late December when temperatures drop a lot.
The entrance fee is about 10 Turkish Lira, so make sure to have some cash with you.

Nice spot. Have to pay an admission ticket to enter however. It's likely best to visit when the balloons are up. The area isn't that large but expect an uphill walk if you're walking here from the city.

Absolutely the best spot in G√∂reme to watch the hot air balloons rise with the sun. The views are surreal - hundreds of colorful balloons floating over the unique landscape is truly a once-in-a-lifetime experience. Make sure to get there by 5:00 AM at the latest to catch the full spectacle from the start. It's peaceful, breathtaking, and pure magic. Don't miss it!

places.address: ƒ∞sali - Gaferli - Avcƒ±lar, 50180 G√∂reme/Nev≈üehir Merkez/Nev≈üehir, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: Red Valley ATV offers a unique and breathtaking experience, especially during the evening when the setting sun transforms the soft red formations into a mesmerizing sea of fire. The ATV tour provides an amazing adventure, with helpful staff who ensure convenience by providing hotel pick-up and drop-off. While some visitors found the tour to be crowded and dusty, others enjoyed driving through the valley despite the rain.

sources.snippet: Taking photos in Red Valley in Cappadocia, Turkey, is a fantastic experience. This valley is famous for its beautiful red and pink rocks. The best times to take pictures are at sunrise and sunset when the light is soft and warm.
sources.shortName: Top 15 photography spots in Cappadocia: A visual Journey

places.name: Red valley ATV

reviews.text: Stunning and an Indiana-Jones type journey if you go.to Red/Rose Valley via the Sword Valley which works for adults but also for children. In thia trail you have to navigate in really narrow and steep wodden and iron stairs in absolutely stunning narrow gorge that you see rarely anybody taking even when you are still in one of the most heavily touristy place in the world! The key to finding thia route is to take the right turn from the exit on the right of Goreme Open Air Museum, from the top of the road. There is a big instruction plate on the right of the asphalt rpad but the plate can hardly be read. We followed an All Trail app trail tp fins this entry to the route and not to get lost - it was absolutely unexpected what we found, a very adventourous journey well worth taking!

Red Valley ATV: An Adrenaline-Fueled Adventure Through Cappadocia's Otherworldly Landscape
Buckle up for an unforgettable adventure! Red Valley ATV in Cappadocia, Turkey, is more than just your typical off-road ride. It's a heart-pounding journey through a landscape sculpted by millions of years of nature's handiwork.
Red Hot and Ready to Roll: The star of the show is, of course, the Red Valley itself. The volcanic soil here paints the landscape a fiery red, especially at sunset, creating a truly otherworldly backdrop for your ATV adventure. As you navigate the dusty trails, prepare to be awestruck by the towering fairy chimneys, hoodoos standing sentinel over the valley floor.
Thrills with a View: The tour itself is a perfect blend of excitement and sightseeing. You'll get behind the wheel of your own ATV (or share with a friend) and follow a guide on a pre-determined route. The pace keeps things interesting, with sections that allow you to open it up a bit and feel the rush of adrenaline, balanced with slower sections where you can soak in the scenery.
Beyond the Red: The beauty of the Red Valley ATV tour is that it takes you beyond just the Red Valley itself. Depending on the tour you choose, you might also wind your way through other Cappadocia gems like the Rose Valley, with its blush-colored cliffs, or Love Valley, famous for its phallic-shaped rock formations (ahem, interesting photo opportunity!).
Geared Up for Fun: Safety is a priority here. The tour operators provide helmets, goggles, and any other necessary gear to keep you protected. They'll also give you a quick safety briefing before setting off, ensuring everyone is comfortable and confident on their ATV.
Here are some things to keep in mind:
Be Adventure Ready: This is an off-road adventure, so expect a bumpy ride and some dust. Dress accordingly in comfortable clothes and closed-toe shoes.
Experience Matters: While no prior ATV experience is necessary, some tours might be better suited for more experienced riders. Check with the operator beforehand.
Capture the Moment: Don't forget your camera! The scenery is begging to be photographed, and you'll definitely want to capture memories of your thrilling ride.

Overall, Red Valley ATV is a fantastic way to experience the unique wonders of Cappadocia. It's perfect for adventure seekers, nature lovers, and anyone who wants to add a dose of excitement to their Cappadocia itinerary.

Great place to watch sunset at Red Valley. Went there during ATV tour. It was the last stop of the tour riding ATV. It was just pure grandeur of a scenery at sunset. A must do when going to Cappadocia!

places.generalDescription: Cappadocia is renowned for its hot air balloon rides, offering a mesmerizing experience as you soar above the extraordinary landscapes. Whether you choose to observe the vibrant balloons from below or take flight yourself, it's an essential part of any visit to the region. Balloon rides can be arranged through hotels or directly with companies, typically involving early morning pick-ups due to wind-dependent flight paths and landing spots.

sources.snippet: Cappadocia is famous for its hot air balloon rides, which provide a unique and unforgettable photography opportunity. Capture the mesmerizing spectacle of dozens of colorful balloons floating against the backdrop of the picturesque landscape. The early morning light, with its soft golden glow, creates a dreamlike ambiance that adds a touch of enchantment to your photographs.
sources.shortName: The Best Photography Spots in Cappadocia

sources.snippet: One of the most iconic images associated with Cappadocia is the sight of hot air balloons floating above the landscape at sunrise. This is a truly magical experience, and there are many companies offering balloon rides for visitors to capture this unforgettable moment. The best way to get to a hot air balloon ride is to have a Cappadocia Travel Pass¬Æ.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Instagrammable Spots in Cappadocia in 2023

sources.snippet: Yes, a hot air balloon flight in Cappadocia is as dreamy as those photos you‚Äôve seen on Pinterest. There are dozens of companies to choose from, but my favorite is Turkiye Balloons. The experience of floating over Cappadocia‚Äôs landscapes at sunrise is absolutely epic.
sources.shortName: Travel Guide to the Fairytale World

sources.snippet: Hot air balloon ride: One of the most popular activities in Cappadocia is a hot air balloon ride, which offers breathtaking views of the landscape from above. The ride provides a unique perspective and many great photo opportunities.

sources.snippet: One of the most popular things to do in Cappadocia is to take a hot air balloon ride at sunrise. The view from above is simply stunning and provides a great opportunity to capture some truly amazing photos.
sources.shortName: The best photo spots in Cappadocia

sources.snippet: This is obviously one of the best ways to see the landscape!. Hot air balloon rides always take place in the morning along with the sunrise!
sources.shortName: The Best Cappadocia Instagram Photo Locations

places.name: Hot Air Balloon Cappadocia

reviews.text: The hot air balloon ride in Cappadocia offers breathtaking views of fairy chimneys, valleys, and sunrise-lit landscapes. A magical, once-in-a-lifetime experience that immerses you in the region's stunning natural beauty.

"In 2024, I had an amazing experience in Cappadocia! I went on a hot air balloon ride with my family, and it was truly one of the best and most impressive parts of our trip to Turkey. We simply couldn't miss out on this incredible experience. The staff was super attentive; they picked us up directly from our hotel, and the price was very fair. We had a beautiful day with lots of opportunities for stunning photos. Our instructor was highly qualified and explained everything thoroughly. Highly recommend!
Best experience of Hot Air Balloons here. The pilot was amazing and the beauty of Cappadocia from over the top is the best feeling ever.

places.address: Isalƒ±-Gaferli-Avcƒ±lar Mah, Demirhan Sk. no:4/a, 50180 Nev≈üehir Merkez/Nev≈üehir, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: Sword Valley, located just over 4 km from Goreme in Cappadocia, offers a stunning panoramic view of the surrounding area. The valley is full of cave dwellings and unique rock formations, making it a great spot for hiking and exploring. It's recommended to visit at sunrise to witness the epic golden hour and watch hot air balloons flying overhead.

sources.snippet: So I spotted this place while doing this hike and I didn‚Äôt regret going back there at sunrise. It is located above the valley of the swords and has a beautiful panoramic view of the surroundings. However, there are a little more than 4 km from G√∂reme so it takes 45 minutes to get there (have a flashlight to be visible when walking in the morning because you walk on tracks that are sometimes used by vehicles carrying hot air balloons).
sources.shortName: best spots to watch hot air balloons at sunrise
Travel Guide to the Fairytale World

places.name: Sword Valley

reviews.text: Absolutely stunning landscape - unique rock formations and peaceful hiking trails. A great place to catch the sunrise or just wander around in nature. Magical atmosphere, especially with hot air balloons in the sky!

Probably the easiest hike in Cappadocia üòä yet just as beautiful as the other ones!

Not 100% sure where exactly is the start, we began the hike where Google pin took us, but it looked like we could have gone in further out to start.

4 out of 5 stars, only because it's also one of those spots that all the ATV, horses and other tours are going through as well, so depending on the season and a month, and the hour you're there at, it can get quite loud - especially with the ATVs.

Good spot for the sunset pictures though! üì∏ with the ATVs creating all the dust around and the sunset - the pictures are coming out quite neat üòç

If you don't feel or can't go for a more challenging walk, but you would like to get a better feel and a look at the beautiful rock formation and the Cappadocia landscape, this one would be for you üôè

It was my last day in Goreme and I decided to go on a ATV Tour. This tour generally costs 20 Euros for 2 hours and they cover three valleys - Love Valley, Rose/Red Valley, Sword Valley. I found this tour totally worth it. If you have more time in hand, you can go for a trekking along these valleys as well which can take 6-8 hours. All these valleys are pretty nice and beautiful. On top of that riding ATV through these valleys was a pretty unique and interesting experience. Sword valley has unique formations which resembles like a sword and hence the name as sword valley.

places.generalDescription: Aydƒ±n Kƒ±raƒüƒ±, also known as Cappadocia, is a captivating destination with its unique rock formations and cave dwellings formed by ancient volcanic eruptions. Visitors highly recommend experiencing the breathtaking sunrise from a hot air balloon to truly appreciate the stunning scenery. The area offers splendid views of Goreme, making it an ideal spot to witness both sunrise and sunset. Despite occasional crowds, finding a peaceful spot on the hillside for photography is possible.

sources.snippet: Aydin Kiragi (The hill between Goreme and Love valley) is one of the most popular spots in the Cappadocia. Aydin Kiragi is only 5 minute walk from Goreme town center. If you‚Äôre going to Cappadocia, you must climb this hill.
sources.shortName: 7 Best Photo Spots around Cappadocia, Turkey

places.name: Aydƒ±n Kƒ±raƒüƒ±

reviews.text: wonderful view of the hot air balloons, 30TL per person to enter. there's a truck up top for drinks and snacks, can get really crowded so show up early. we showed up over an hour before ‚Äúsunset‚Äù

It is a very touristy place. Go early in the morning for a less crowded experience. Plenty of shops, ATMs, parking terrain. You can take beautiful pictures here except for the churches where you are not allowed to take pictures or make videos. This also applies to the churches you need to pay extra for to visit.

Amazing sunset but the cafe close by is an absolute rip-off. In contrast to all the nice and welcoming Turkish people, the owner of this au Steg Point Caf√© just tries to exploit tourist and pretend it's his sunset point. He behave like the sultan and is ride to people walking by. Definitly avoid going in - the sunset view is much better on the opposite site a 50 m walk! Enjoyyyy!

places.address: Seyir Tepesi, ƒ∞sali - Gaferli - Avcƒ±lar, Aydƒ±n Kƒ±raƒüƒ± Sk., 50180 G√∂reme/Nev≈üehir Merkez/Nev≈üehir, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: Sunrise Point in Goreme is a popular spot where travelers gather before dawn to witness the mesmerizing sight of hot air balloons floating through the Cappadocian sky. It's an ideal location for both sunrise and sunset views, especially for those without transportation. Visitors can borrow blankets and pillows to create a cozy picnic spot while taking in the breathtaking scenery. Many recommend arriving at 5 am to catch the stunning display of balloons, making it a memorable experience worth cherishing.

sources.shortName: Travel Guide to the Fairytale World

places.name: Sunrise Point

reviews.text: This place in Cappadocia is truly breathtaking and a must-visit destination. I highly recommend exploring it on foot, rather than by taxi, to take in the stunning views of the entire town.
Great views from all angles. Our cave hotel was within walking distance. You can also get here by car. Great place to see the Uchisar Castle. The views are also spectacular at night.

Goreme Sunrise Point is truly a jewel in Cappadocia, offering one of the most breathtaking 360-degree panoramas of the region. Standing at the summit, as the first rays of dawn paint the ancient valleys and peaks, it's easy to feel as if you're gazing upon a celestial canvas.

The sunrise here is nothing short of magical. As the soft hues of pink, orange, and gold cast their glow over the landscape, countless hot air balloons rise gracefully into the sky, creating a scene that feels like a surreal dream. This point also boasts numerous designated spots perfect for capturing those unforgettable moments. Each corner seems crafted with photographers in mind, offering unique backdrops that capture the spirit of Goreme.

In the midst of this scenic splendor, the iconic Turkish flag and Red Crescent structure proudly stand, adding a touch of local heritage to the experience. These symbols not only enhance the ambiance but remind visitors of Turkey's deep-rooted culture and history.

For anyone visiting Cappadocia, Goreme Sunrise Point is not merely a destination but an experience that etches itself deeply in memory. Whether you come for the views, the photographs, or the peaceful sunrise, this place holds something special for every soul.

places.address: ƒ∞sali - Gaferli - Avcƒ±lar, 50180 G√∂reme/Nev≈üehir Merkez/Nev≈üehir, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: Sultan Carpets, established in 1989, offers a vast collection of exquisite Turkish carpets and ambient lighting. Visitors can pay a small fee to partake in a unique photo shoot within the store. The owner, fluent in English due to previous residency in Seattle, provides insights into the stunning handwoven rugs and their pricing structure. The picture spaces are captivating and worth the additional charge for an unforgettable experience.

sources.snippet: The roof terrace of the Sultan Cave Suites is one of the best photo locations in Cappadocia and boasts, arguably, the best view of the hot air balloons rising over Goreme and the Cappadocia Valleys ‚Äì check prices now!
sources.siteName: The Whole World Is A Playground
sources.shortName: Best Photo Locations in Cappadocia (with Map)

sources.snippet: A beloved carpet seller in Cappadocia, Sultan Carpets has also cottoned on to the Instagram trend and is taking advantage by offering a few different photo services.
sources.shortName: 21 Magically Instagrammable Places in Cappadocia

places.name: Sultan Carpets

reviews.text: Absolutely amazing. The owner spoke perfect English he used to live in Seattle even though he's fully Turkish, the rugs he has were absolutely beautiful mostly handwoven with very expensive prices but he was able to explain their pricing structure and if you think about the lifespan of these carpets and how long it takes to make them it makes perfect sense. The picture spaces were absolutely gorgeous and yes there is a small charge to take pictures here but absolutely worth it for the experience. Family owned and operated business with amazing products 10/10 would recommend.

This place was great. Great picture moments and the price is great only 10 euros and that comes with a traditional outfit! We were able to walk in and the people before us was wrapping it up. This is definitely a must do!

We had a wonderful experience at Sultan Carpets. We intentionally visited the store to do a self-guided photoshoot, and the owner warmly welcomed us upon arrival. When we mentioned our plan, he was very accommodating and pointed us to the second level of the store, where the setup is located.

The space costs ‚Ç¨20 for 30 minutes, which is quite affordable compared to similar places, based on other reviews I've read. They also offer a professional photographer with drone services for ‚Ç¨100, but we brought our own tripod and remote clicker, so we did everything ourselves.

The great part is that you get the entire space to yourself, which is comforting when you're paying for a private session. Usually, they require bookings in advance, but since the space was free when we arrived, we were able to start right away. If you have a specific time in mind, it's best to visit in advance and reserve.

The setup upstairs is absolutely divine-beautiful carpets, bench, pillows and vibrant lamps create a magical atmosphere. We weren't rushed at all and were able to finish our shoot comfortably.

Afterwards, we had a pleasant chat with the owner about the carpets on display. He has such a positive vibe, which was a lovely touch. We also learned that they organize international shipping if you decide to purchase larger carpets, which is great to know if you're traveling.

Highly recommended!

places.address: ƒ∞sali - Gaferli - Avcƒ±lar, M√ºze Cd. No:32, 50180 G√∂reme/Nev≈üehir Merkez/Nev≈üehir, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: Love Valley, also known as the Ihlara Valley, is a stunning canyon formed by volcanic activity and erosion over thousands of years. Stretching about 10 km with a depth of 100 meters, it served as a rocky settlement for monasteries from the 4th to 13th centuries. Located in Goreme, its unique rock formations have earned it the nickname 'Love Valley,' featuring phallic-shaped structures that add an element of humor to the natural beauty.

sources.snippet: This spot is located in the heart of the Love Valley (and not on the viewpoints outside the valley accessible by car and which are crowded in the morning) and I lived one of the most beautiful sunrises of my life. It is actually 3-4 km from the centre of G√∂reme (30-45 min by foot) on this hiking route that I described to you some time ago. Leave at least 45 minutes before sunrise to get there in time.
sources.shortName: best spots to watch hot air balloons at sunrise

sources.snippet: This valley is named after the thousands of pigeons that used to be kept for their droppings, which were used as fertilizer. It's spot to capture photos of the fairy chimneys and the valley below6. Rose Valley: This valley is named after the pink and red hues that the rocks take on during sunset.
sources.shortName: The best photo spots in Cappadocia

sources.snippet: Love Valley, located 10 - 15 minutes from Goreme on a dirt track parallel to the main road between Goreme and Cavusin. This stunning area is truly a hidden gem in Cappadocia. It is great for after sunrise photo shooting as this area is the landing site for the hot air balloon rides.
sources.shortName: 7 Best Photo Spots around Cappadocia, Turkey

sources.snippet: Taking photos in Love Valley during sunset is a wonderful experience. This valley, found in Cappadocia, Turkey, is famous for its unusual, tall rock formations that look like giant pillars. When the sun sets, the whole area glows with a warm, golden light.
sources.shortName: Top 15 photography spots in Cappadocia: A visual Journey

sources.snippet: Love valley is particularly one of the places frequently visited by couples who come to Cappadocia together. The region has an interesting story. In ancient times, there was a small village in this valley.
sources.shortName: Best Places to take photos in G√∂reme

sources.snippet: Love Valley: This valley is named for its unique rock formations, which resemble giant phallic shapes. The valley offers a stunning backdrop for photos and is especially beautiful at sunset.
sources.shortName: What are the Best Photo Spots in Cappadocia?

sources.snippet: Pigeon Valley: With its distinct pigeon homes carved into the rocks, this valley offers a picturesque setting for balloon photography.
sources.shortName: Balloons Of Cappadocia | Top 10 Photo Spots at the Cappadocia Hot Air Balloon Festival

places.name: Love Valley

reviews.text: An excellent place to hike. The trail is generally straight forward but there are a few forks that split off and generally meet back. The lower trail has the best grade for walking. Also, you need to watch your footing when walking over loose earth in places. However, it's totally worth the amazing views and a nice break from the crowds (we rarely encountered other hikers).

It was my last day in Goreme and I decided to go on a ATV Tour. This tour generally costs 20 Euros for 2 hours and they cover three valleys - Love Valley, Rose/Red Valley, Sword Valley. I found this tour totally worth it. If you have more time in hand, you can go for a trekking along these valleys as well which can take 6-8 hours. All these valleys are pretty nice and beautiful. On top of that riding ATV through these valleys was a pretty unique and interesting experience. Love valley has unique formations which looks like male reproductive part and hence the name as love valley. Couples do tie up clay pots here as a belief that will make their love stay forever.

Amazing spot to see the balloons show.  Tip: Get there around 6 am or even early. depending on how the weather is.  It's not allowed to fly drones when the balloons are in the air, but it's a great spot for it.
Around 7:30, almost all the balloons will be landed or about to land.

places.address: Baƒülƒ±dere Vadisi, Tekelli, 50180 U√ßhisar/Nev≈üehir Merkez/Nev≈üehir, T√ºrkiye
